thread.title: Spirits of 1908: Wisconsin Badgers football victorious over Indiana ... and Chicago Cubs win World Series
thread.title_full: Spirits of 1908: Wisconsin Badgers football victorious over Indiana ... and Chicago Cubs win World Series

author: Sarah Wolf Staff writer
title: Spirits of 1908: Wisconsin Badgers football victorious over Indiana ... and Chicago Cubs win World Series
text: â€¢ Granlund cartoon: Cubs are contenders On Monday, Oct. 19, 1908, "Badgers happy over victory but fear maroons" was the Rockford Daily Republic's big sports headline of the day. The Wisconsin University football team had a big win over the Indiana University Hoosiers, but it sounds like the QB got a little banged up. "Some of the members of the team criticised (sic) the Hoosiers for rough treatment of 'Keckle' Moll, the Badgers quarterback, who seemed to be marked for hard handling because of his goal kicking ability. He was all but knocked out at the end of the first half, and in the second half he became so groggy that he didn't realize what he was doing and had to be replaced by Cunningham." As the Cubs gain traction in the playoffs, make sure to follow news from 1908 in print and at rrstar.com . By Sarah Wolf
